decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to generate fast and consistent damage output, with multiple ways to sacrifice artifacts for additional benefits. It includes cards that support the Affinity mechanic, such as Myr Enforcer and Thoughtcast, as well as removal and card draw options. By sacrificing artifacts with cards like Makeshift Munitions and Krark-Clan Shaman, players can deal damage to their opponent while also triggering synergies with other cards in the deck. The deck aims to establish early board presence and pressure opponents with a steady stream of damage.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures and controlling the game with counterspells and card draw. Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent provide early threats while Tolarian Terror and Lórien Revealed offer additional aggression. Card draw spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Deep Analysis help maintain card advantage, while counterspells like Counterspell and Dispel protect your creatures. Thought Scour and Mental Note help fill up the graveyard for Cryptic Serpent. Sleep of the Dead can provide a way to tap down opponent's creatures for a final push.

This Pauper Jund Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and utilizing land destruction with Twisted Landscape and Cleansing Wildfire. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence with creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Refurbished Familiar, while also generating card advantage with Ichor Wellspring. Additionally, the deck utilizes removal spells like Cast Down and Toxin Analysis to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Krark-Clan Shaman helps to disrupt graveyard strategies commonly seen in Pauper formats.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing a mix of creatures like Goblin Tomb Raider, Voldaren Epicure, and Burning-Tree Emissary, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Goblin Bushwhacker provide ways to buff your creatures and finish off the opponent quickly. The deck also includes some card draw and mana acceleration to maintain momentum.

The deck focuses on using cheap creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and graveyard hate. The deck utilizes sacrifice effects and land destruction to control the board and maintain aggression. The key strategy is to generate value from sacrificing artifacts and creatures, while also utilizing burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to be proactive and apply pressure from the beginning of the game, forcing the opponent to react to its threats and disrupting their game plan.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing artifacts to generate value, disrupting opponents with removal spells and graveyard hate, while also having a secondary win condition with Nyxborn Hydra. The deck aims to control the board with targeted removal, generate card advantage with artifacts like Ichor Wellspring, and close out games quickly by sacrificing artifacts for additional damage or by overwhelming opponents with efficient creatures. The deck utilizes a mix of creature removal, artifact synergy, and graveyard disruption to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively burn the opponent's life total, using efficient burn spells and creatures with abilities that deal damage. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life points to zero by consistently dealing damage through spells like Lightning Bolt, Fireblast, and Lava Dart, as well as creatures like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather. Additionally, the deck includes card draw effects like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize to maintain hand advantage and consistency in dealing damage.

The Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with cheap, evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and bounce spells like Tolarian Terror and Sleep of the Dead. The deck also leverages card draw and selection to ensure a consistent flow of threats and answers. By applying pressure early and maintaining control of the board, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with low-cost creatures like Carrion Feeder and Mortician Beetle, while using cards like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption to maintain card advantage and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some graveyard recursion through cards like Unearth and Supernatural Stamina to bring back key creatures for additional pressure. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on using gates and control elements to stall the opponent's progress and establish a dominant board presence. By using a combination of creature removal, counter spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game until its win conditions can be established. The inclusion of Lórien Revealed and Basilisk Gate provides additional card advantage and creature protection, while cards like Prismatic Strands and Envelop help to protect against opposing threats. Overall, the deck's key concept is to establish control through gates and various control elements to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play low cost creatures and use counter spells to control the opponent's plays, while also drawing cards and returning creatures to hand with bounce spells. It relies on a quick aggressive start to overwhelm the opponent and maintain tempo throughout the match. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain control of the board through counter spells and creature bounce effects.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana using creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Axebane Guardian, while also cycling through the deck with cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede. The key focus is to quickly get Balustrade Spy onto the battlefield and use its ability to mill the entire deck, setting up for a combo finish with Dread Return and Lotleth Giant to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes various creatures and spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures and control spells while efficiently using card draw and counterspells to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By consistently applying early pressure and disrupting the opponent's plays, the deck aims to overwhelm and defeat the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. The combination of cheap creatures, card draw, and counterspells allows the deck to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle throughout the game.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Mortician Beetle and Carrion Feeder, and then using sacrifice effects such as Village Rites and Rite of Consumption to deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Perigee Beckoner and Infestation Sage to generate value from sacrificing creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and constant creature threats while utilizing the graveyard as a resource for additional benefits.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with small, evasive creatures and pump spells to deal damage efficiently and effectively. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain a steady stream of threats throughout the game. The use of hexproof and regeneration abilities on creatures ensures they can stick around to continue dealing damage, while also protecting them from removal spells. The deck's goal is to quickly close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The main focus of this deck is to maximize mana production using High Tide while utilizing various card draw spells and manipulation effects to dig through the deck quickly and find combo pieces. It aims to generate a large amount of mana in a single turn to cast a game-winning spell or sequence of spells. The deck includes a mix of card draw, manipulation, and combo pieces to help achieve this goal efficiently and consistently.
